CatDescriptText: Jimmy Butler, 65 Arthur Street and M. Griffin, 65 Arthur Street, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" Jimmy Butler's answer reads: "Yes, and the reason is to insure prompt and efficient service similar to that which New York has." M. Griffin's answer reads: "I think that the city should.  This would improve the transportation system very much."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Jimmy Butler, and M. Griffin wearing light colored hat, moustache, and light colored overcoat with right hand in pocket, standing on sidewalk under marque with ornate ticket booth on the right
